meanings.definition: The quality or state of being diligent or persistent in work or effort.
meanings.sent1: Her sedulity in completing all her tasks on time impressed her boss.
meanings.sent2: His sedulity in studying for the exam paid off with a high score.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel showed great sedulity in gathering nuts for the winter.
meanings.sent4: The flowers bloomed with the sedulity of a dedicated gardener tending to them daily.
meanings.sent5: The ant's sedulity in collecting food for the colony was unmatched.

meanings.definition: The act of being diligent or persistent in work or effort.
meanings.sent1: The sedulity of the students in their group project led to its successful completion.
meanings.sent2: She approached her job with sedulity, always striving to do her best.
meanings.sent3: The sedulity of the detective in solving the case was commendable.
meanings.sent4: The marathon runner displayed sedulity as she pushed through the last few miles.
meanings.sent5: The artist's sedulity in perfecting each brushstroke was evident in the masterpiece.
